notification.name: Vivado and Vitis 2024.1 Available for Download
notification.desc:
Download Vivado and Vitis 2024.1 now, with support for
  • Vivado 2024.1: Release Highlights​
    • General Access of MicroBlaze™ V soft processor (based on RISC V Open-Source ISA).
    • QoR (FMAX) Enhancements for Versal Devices ​​– Multi-SLR Versal devices & more user control.​​​
    • Dynamic Function eXchange (DFX) Enhancements​​ – new reporting command and tandem +DFX support for Versal SSIT devices​​​.
    • Power Design Manager​​ – new support for Zynq™ RFSoC devices.
  • Vitis 2024.1: Release Highlights​
    • New DSP functions and API for AI engines.
    • Key improvements to AMD Vitis™ Embedded Software​ including support for AMD MicroBlaze™ V processors.
    • New AMD Vitis IDE​ features.
  • Vitis Model Composer 2024.1: Release Highlights
    • New & Enhanced DSPlib functions supported for AIE and AIE-ML within AMD Vitis™ Model Composer​.
    • Ease of use improvements to AMD Vitis Model Composer Hub block.
  • Vitis HLS 2024.1: Release Highlights​​
    • QoR Enhancements – stencil pragma for video functions and Code Analyzer features to fine-tune performance analysis.
    • Ease-of-Use Features – RTL blackbox, HLS component comparison, and access to Clang sanitizers during C-Simulation.
  • Embedded System Software 2024.1: Release Highlights​​
    • Enhanced Security: Upgraded Arm Trusted Firmware (TF-A 2.10), Xen hypervisor (v4.18), and Linux kernel (v6.6). AIE driver now supports Linux PAN for increased security.
    • Production Ready: Microblaze-V is now production-supported.
    • Simplified Development: Yocto supports building embedded software components through SDT and Lopper.
    • BSP Sunsetting Notice: the following BSPs are being sunset:
      • AMD MicroBlaze™:VCU118, KCU105, KC705, AC701
      • AMD Zynq™ platform:ZC706
      • AMD Versal™ device:VMK180-EMMC, VMK180-OSPI
      • AMD Zynq MPSoC:ZCU111

notification.name: Vivado 2023.1.1 is now available
notification.desc:
Download Vivado ML Edition 2023.1.1 now, with support for
  • Versal Premium series:
    • Package Updates:
      • Support for VFVF1760 package for XCVP1402 and XCVP1102.
      • Support for VSVD2197 package for XCVP1402.
      • Support for VSVC2021 package for XCVP1052.
    • Speedfile Updates:
      • -1MP,-2MP,-3HP speed files in production for the following devices: XCVP1402, XCVP1102, XCVM2302, XCVM2902.
      • -3HP speed files in production for following devices: XCVP1502, XCVP1702, XCVP1802.
      • -2LLI speed files in production for the following devices: XCVP1052.
  • Versal Prime Series:
    • Package Updates:
      • Support for VFVF1760 package for XCVM2302 and XCVM2902.
      • Support for VSRA2197 package for XQVM1502.
    • Speedfile Updates:
      • -1LP, -1LHP, -1MP, -2LP speed files in production for the following devices: XCVM2302, XCVM2902.
      • -1LP, -1LHP, -1MP, -2MP, -1MM speed files in production for following devices: XQVM1502.
  • Versal Edge Series:
    • Speedfile Updates:
      • -2HP speed files in production for following devices: XCVE2802.
  • Versal Core Series:
    • Speedfile Updates:
      • -2HP speed files in production for following devices: XCVC2802.
For customers using these devices, AMD-Xilinx recommends installing Vivado 2023.1.1.
For other devices, please continue to use Vivado ML 2023.1.
